thread.title: Five GOP candidates to speak at Presidential Family Forum
thread.title_full: Five GOP candidates to speak at Presidential Family Forum

title: Five GOP candidates to speak at Presidential Family Forum
text:
Five GOP candidates to speak at Presidential Family Forum Matthew Patane , mpatane@dmreg.com 12:30 p.m. CDT October 15, 2015 Buy Photo Governor Bobby Jindal speaks with Frank Luntz during the Family Leadership Summit in Ames on Saturday, July 18, 2015. (Photo: Brian Powers/The Register) Buy Photo 
Five Republican presidential candidates are confirmed to attend the upcoming 2015 Presidential Family Forum, hosted by The Family Leader Foundation. 
Texas Sen. Ted Cruz , Kentucky Sen. Rand Paul , Louisiana Gov. Bobby Jindal , former Arkansas Gov. Mike Huckabee and former Pennsylvania Sen. Rick Santorum will attend the forum, the Family Leader said in a statement. 
The Family Leader Foundation said it invited all 15 major Republican candidates competing for their party's presidential nomination. 
Follow Iowa Caucus news, photos, videos with Iowa Caucuses App: iPhone or iPad | Android 
Also visit: DesMoinesRegister.com/IowaCaucuses | Candidate tracker and calendar in Iowa | Sign up for Caucuses Newsletter 
The Presidential Family Forum is scheduled for Friday Nov. 20 at the Community Choice Credit Union Convention Center, 233 Center St., Des Moines. 
Pollster Frank Luntz will moderate the forum, facilitating a discussion between the candidates and audience members. Luntz also moderated this year's Family Leadership Summit in Ames. 
"The Presidential Family Forum gives us a chance to see what's in the candidates' hearts, not just what's in their plans," Bob Vander Plaats, CEO of the The Family Leader Foundation, said in a statement. 
The Family Leader Foundation last held the forum in 2011, drawing about 3,000 attendees, according to the statement. 1 CONNECT 1 TWEET LINKEDIN 3 COMMENT EMAIL MORE Read or Share this story: http://dmreg.co/1RKirST TOP VIDEOS
